message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR 

This paper deals with the task of detecting sensitive language in open-ended human-chatbot interactions, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a semi-supervised approach to bootstrap large-scale data, which involves training weakly supervised models and using publicly available annotated datasets, indicating the involvement of machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also involves data selection methods and scoring sentences from online discussion forums, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
